alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and southeastern Franklin Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 858 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Huntland, or 14 miles south of Winchester, moving east-southeastward at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Stevenson, Anderson, Hytop, Bass, Jericho, Russell Cave National Monument, Fabius, Estillfork and Fackler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee.
